Class TCPSockWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • TCPSockWrapper

  • public class TCPSockWrapper
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TCPSockWrapper(TCPManager tcpMan, Node node, int readBuffSize, int writeBuffSize)
      Create a new TCPSockWrapper as the client, without knowing the foreign address and port.
      TCPSockWrapper(TCPManager tcpMan, Node node, int readBuffSize, int writeBuffSize, int foreignAddress, int foreignPort, int localAddress, int localPort)
      Create a new TCPSockWrapper as the server, specifying a foreign address and port.

      • TCPSockWrapper

        public TCPSockWrapper(TCPManager tcpMan,
                      Node node,
                      int readBuffSize,
                      int writeBuffSize)
        Create a new TCPSockWrapper as the client, without knowing the foreign address and port. You can connect later.

    • Method Detail

      • writeToReadBuff

        public void writeToReadBuff(byte[] bytes)
                     throws java.nio.BufferOverflowException
        Parameters:
        bytes - Bytes to be written into read buffer
        Throws:
        java.nio.BufferOverflowException

      • writeToWriteBuff

        public void writeToWriteBuff(byte[] bytes)
                      throws java.nio.BufferOverflowException
        Write some bytes to the write buffer. Throws BufferOverflowException if the write buffer is full, so it is the caller's responsibility to check if the buffer is full already.
        Parameters:
        bytes - Bytes to be written into write buffer
        Throws:
        java.nio.BufferOverflowException

      • readFromReadBuff

        public byte[] readFromReadBuff(int numBytes)
        Parameters:
        bytes - Maximum number of bytes to read from read buffer
        Returns:
        Bytes read

      • readFromWriteBuff

        public byte[] readFromWriteBuff(int numBytes)
        Parameters:
        numBytes - Maximum number of bytes to read from write buffer
        Returns:
        Bytes read

      • flushWriteBuff

        public int flushWriteBuff()
        Send contents of write buffer down wire.
        Returns:
        int -1 on failure, 0 otherwise.

      • handleTransport

        public void handleTransport(Transport transport,
                            int from)
        Handle an incoming Transport on this connection
        Parameters:
        transport - The incoming Transport
        from - The incoming address

      • setupConnection

        public int setupConnection(java.lang.Integer destAddr,
                           java.lang.Integer destPort)
        Set up a connection to destination port/IP. The associated socket must be closed for this to work Connection status is handled in the Socket itself, so state is set upon returning.
        Parameters:
        destAddr - destination address to connect to
        destPort - destination port to connect to
        Returns:
        int 0 on success, -1 otherwise

      • acceptConnection

        public TCPSock acceptConnection()
        Accept a new connection, and return an appropriate socket for it.
        Returns:
        A TCPSock from queue, or null if queue empty or an error occurs

      • close

        public void close()
        Try to gracefully close this connection. This causes the state to change to SHUTDOWN as all remaining data is sent. Once all data is sent, the state changes to closed.

      • getReadBuffSize

        public int getReadBuffSize()
        Return how many bytes are in read buffer.
        Returns:
        int The number of bytes currently in read buffer.

      • getWriteBuffSize

        public int getWriteBuffSize()
        Return how many bytes are in read buffer. NOT how many can be safely written.
        Returns:
        int The number of bytes currently in write buffer.

      • getReadBuffSpaceRemaining

        public int getReadBuffSpaceRemaining()
        Return how many bytes can be written to read buff.
        Returns:
        the amount of space left in the read buffer.

      • getWriteBuffSpaceRemaining

        public int getWriteBuffSpaceRemaining()
        Return how many bytes can be written to write buff.
        Returns:
        the amount of space left in the read buffer.

      • getTCPSock

        public TCPSock getTCPSock()
        Return the associated socket.
        Returns:
        TCPSock The associated socket.

      • getState

        public TCPSockWrapper.State getState()
        Get this socket's state. Called from TCPSock.
        Returns:
        State The socket's state.

      • setListening

        public void setListening(int backlog)
        Set this socket listening.
        Parameters:
        backlog - int How many concurrent backlogged connections are allowed

      • setClosed

        public void setClosed()
        Set this socket closed and release all resources.

      • setReceiveHelper

        public void setReceiveHelper()
        Set this socket receiving data. This is the starting point for TCP Code.
